column4: what's a reason that ubuntu would freeze during installation?
or if installing to flash, it may take longer
i did the test cd for defects, and test memory, both passed with flying colors.
let it sit for a while, i've 30meg isos take 40 minutes to install before, shrug
if it's a live cd, pop open a terminal and watch top and iostat to make sure stuff is being written
it freezes before i can do anything.
i cant even move the mouse.
or open the cd drive.. everything freezes.
oh... hmm,, how much ram does the box have?
yeah, i've had installs fail at 256mb, you might need to find an alternative means of installation... like popping the hdd into a device with more ram if possible then moving it back out again
ahhh.. Makes sense. I only have a laptop available, is there a way to hook a hdd (if its an internal) to the laptop? or is that not possible?
yeah, you can get usb to laptop adapters off newegg or amazon for less than $10
awesome.. thanks for ur help, i imagine thats what it is, not enough ram. i think i can get a stick of ram for that box for cheap as well. thanks again.
